programme.desc: The English Premier League, also known as the Premier League or Premiership, is the top-level division in English football.The Premier League is the most watched sports league and the richest championship in the world.The competition was founded in 1888 as the First Division and transformed in 1992 as the Premier League.The founders of the First Division in 1888 were Accrington, Aston Villa, Blackburn, Bolton, Burnley, Darby C, Everton, Wolverhampton, Stoke C, West Bromwich, Notts C and Preston.The most successful teams are: Manchester U, Liverpool, Arsenal, Everton, Manchester C, Aston Villa, Sunderland and Chelsea.

programme.title: Football: Bundesliga: Round 9: Heidenheim - Eintracht Frankfurt
programme.desc: First Bundesliga is the highest level of German club football.It was established on August 24, 1963, it is a continuation of the German football championship, which existed since 1903. The founders of the Bundesliga in 1963 were Borussia Dortmund, Eintracht Braunschweig, Eintracht Frankfurt, Hamburger SV, Hertha Berlin, Kaiserslautern, Karlsruhe, Cologne, Maidenrich, 1860 Munich, Nuremberg, Preussen Münster,Saarbrücken, Schalke 04, Stuttgart and Werder.The first champion in 1964 was Cologne.The most successful team in the German First Bundesliga is undoubtedly Bayern Munich, which until 2023 has won 32 titles from 60 editions of the championship.

programme.title: Basketball: NBA: Cleveland Cavaliers - Atlanta Hawks
programme.desc: The National Basketball Association (in English: National Basketball Association, NBA), abbreviated NBA, is the world's most prestigious men's professional basketball league and among the 4 major professional sports leagues in North America.It was established on June 6, 1946 in New York under the name American Basketball Association (ABA).It received its new name in the fall of 1949 after the merger with the National Basketball League of the United States (NBL).The two most successful teams in the NBA are the Los Angeles Lakers and the Boston Celtics, who have won the title 17 times each.Other teams that became champions are: Golden State Warriors (7), Chicago Bulls (6), San Antonio Spurs (5), Philadelphia 76 (7), Detroit Pistons (3), Miami Heat (3), New York Knicks (2), Houston Rockets (2), Milwaukee Bucks (2), Cleveland Cavaliers (1), Washington Wizards (1), Atlanta Hawks (1), Oklahoma Thunder(1), Portland Trail Blazers (2), Baltimore Bullets (1), Dallas Mavericks (1), Toronto Raptors (1), Denver Nuggets (1) and Rochester Royals (1).

programme.title: Football: FA Cup: Round 1: Brackley Town v Notts County
programme.desc: The Football Association Challenge Cup (in English: Football Association Challenge Cup), better known as the FA Cup, is an elimination tournament in English football.The name "FA Cup" refers to the English men's football tournament.The equivalent competition for women is called the FA Women's Cup.The FA Cup is the oldest football competition in the world.The beginning was made on July 20, 1871 in London, and the purpose of the competition is to have all the clubs - members of the federation - participate in it.15 teams took part in the first competition.The FA Cup competition involves all teams up to the ninth tier of English football, as well as some from the 10th tier.A record 763 clubs participated in the 2011-12 season.Over the years, the participation of teams from the lower divisions has led to sensational victories over the big clubs, although clubs from the lower divisions rarely reach the final of the tournament.

programme.title: Football: Ligue 1 of France: Round 11: Brest - Lyon
programme.desc: League 1 consists of 20 teams competing against each other in 38 rounds, on an alternating away basis.The French championship dates back to 1892, the so-called Amateur League until 1929. In 1932, the foundations of professionally organized football in France were laid.The French Division 1 included in its first season, 1932-33, the following teams, divided into two groups: Club Française, Excelsior, Hierre, Lille, Marseille, Mulhouse, Nice, Nîmes, Racing Paris, Sette, Ale, Antibes, Cannes, SA Paris, Fives, Metz, Montpellier, Red Star, Rennes and Sochaux.In recent years, the club Paris Saint-Germain, formed much later, has been an absolute dominator on the domestic scene, but before that Lyon, Marseille, Bordeaux, Monaco, Nantes, Saint-Etienne, Reims, Nice, Lance, etc. also had a lot of success.

The founders of the Bundesliga in 1963 were Borussia Dortmund, Eintracht Braunschweig, Eintracht Frankfurt, Hamburger SV, Hertha Berlin, Kaiserslautern, Karlsruhe, Cologne, Maidenrich, 1860 Munich, Nuremberg, Preussen Münster,Saarbrücken, Schalke 04, Stuttgart and Werder.The first champion in 1964 was Cologne.The most successful team in the German First Bundesliga is undoubtedly Bayern Munich, which until 2023 has won 32 titles from 60 editions of the championship.

programme.title: Football: FA Cup: Round 1: Tamworth v Leyton Orient
programme.desc: The Football Association Challenge Cup (in English: Football Association Challenge Cup), better known as the FA Cup, is an elimination tournament in English football.The name "FA Cup" refers to the English men's football tournament.The equivalent competition for women is called the FA Women's Cup.The FA Cup is the oldest football competition in the world.The beginning was made on July 20, 1871 in London, and the purpose of the competition is to have all the clubs - members of the federation - participate in it.15 teams took part in the first competition.The FA Cup competition involves all teams up to the ninth tier of English football, as well as some from the 10th tier.A record 763 clubs participated in the 2011-12 season.Over the years, the participation of teams from the lower divisions has led to sensational victories over the big clubs, although clubs from the lower divisions rarely reach the final of the tournament.

programme.desc: The Elite Champions League of Asia is a football club competition in which the best clubs from the Asian football leagues participate, organized under the auspices of the AFC.It is the most important club football competition on the continent and is the equivalent of the European Champions League.Until autumn 2024, the tournament was known as the AFC Champions League of Asia, but the competition has since been renamed the Elite Champions League of Asia

programme.title: Football: Ligue 1 France: Round 11: Auxerre - Marseille
programme.desc: League 1 consists of 20 teams competing against each other in 38 rounds, on an alternating away basis.The French championship dates back to 1892, the so-called Amateur League until 1929. In 1932, the foundations of professionally organized football in France were laid.The French Division 1 included in its first season, 1932-33, the following teams, divided into two groups: Club Française, Excelsior, Hierre, Lille, Marseille, Mulhouse, Nice, Nîmes, Racing Paris, Sette, Ale, Antibes, Cannes, SA Paris, Fives, Metz, Montpellier, Red Star, Rennes and Sochaux.In recent years, the club Paris Saint-Germain, formed much later, has been an absolute dominator on the domestic scene, but before that Lyon, Marseille, Bordeaux, Monaco, Nantes, Saint-Etienne, Reims, Nice, Lance, etc. also had a lot of success.

programme.title: Football: efbet League: Round 14: Dobruja - Spartak Varna
programme.desc: The Bulgarian football championship has been played since 1924 with direct eliminations, and since 1948 in the form of a single league.Attempts to form a league in the first level of Bulgarian football were also made before 1948. In the period 1937-1940, a National Football Division (NFD) was established in Bulgaria with 10 teams, which played each against each other on an exchange visit in one season.The champion of the NFD was declared the champion of Bulgaria.It is important to note that "A" RFG, the Premier League, "A" PFG and the current First League are accepted by football history and statistics as the first level in the championship of Bulgaria from 1948 to today, the division in which our strongest clubs compete.At the same time, the NFD was an integral part of the State Championship before 1944 and its three editions were not included in the assets of the "A" group.

programme.title: Basketball: NBA: Oklahoma City Thunder - New Orleans Pelicans
programme.desc: The National Basketball Association (in English: National Basketball Association, NBA), abbreviated NBA, is the world's most prestigious men's professional basketball league and among the 4 major professional sports leagues in North America.It was established on June 6, 1946 in New York under the name American Basketball Association (ABA).It received its new name in the fall of 1949 after the merger with the National Basketball League of the United States (NBL).The two most successful teams in the NBA are the Los Angeles Lakers and the Boston Celtics, who have won the title 17 times each.Other teams that became champions are: Golden State Warriors (7), Chicago Bulls (6), San Antonio Spurs (5), Philadelphia 76 (7), Detroit Pistons (3), Miami Heat (3), New York Knicks (2), Houston Rockets (2), Milwaukee Bucks (2), Cleveland Cavaliers (1), Washington Wizards (1), Atlanta Hawks (1), Oklahoma Thunder(1), Portland Trail Blazers (2), Baltimore Bullets (1), Dallas Mavericks (1), Toronto Raptors (1), Denver Nuggets (1) and Rochester Royals (1).

programme.title: ATP 1000: Paris: First Semi-Final
programme.desc: The tournament is of key importance, as it is often in Paris that decides which tennis players will secure a place in the final tournament of the year, the ATP Finals.With a prize fund of over 5 million euros, the competition attracts all the leading names in world tennis.Over the years, legendary players such as Novak Djokovic, who holds a record six titles, Daniel Medvedev, Holger Rune, Andy Murray, Roger Federer and Marat Safin have become champions in Paris.With its dynamics, fast pace and unpredictability, the Rolex Paris Masters traditionally offers spectacular matches and often becomes an arena of surprises and dramatic twists.This is the last big test for the stars of the tour before the final battle of the season.

programme.title: Motoring: Nascar Cup Series: Round 37: Arizona Race
programme.desc: NASCAR (in English: National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing, NASCAR) is a motor sports series that takes place in the United States.In the early 20th century, when alcohol was banned in the US, bootleggers modified their cars to outrun the police.To this end, races have been held on the beaches of Daytona.After a while, these competitions aroused the interest of the people, and so the competitions became public.The sport began to develop after the Second World War, when different competitions with different rules were organized.The first NASCAR race was held in 1947 by Daytona president, Bill France Sr., two months later on February 15, 1948, the first official NASCAR race was held at the same track and the winner was Red Byron with a Ford.But a championship was not held because most teams had economic problems caused by the lack of gasoline.

programme.title: Moto3: Malaysian Grand Prix: Round 20: Race
programme.desc: The Moto3 Malaysian Grand Prix is ​​part of the World Motorcycle Championship.The competition takes place at the Sepang circuit in Malaysia and brings together young racers driving 250cc motorcycles.It is usually held at the end of the season, is often decisive for the title and is characterized by a hot and humid climate that puts severe tests on the drivers.

programme.title: Basketball: Euroleague: Round 8: Real Madrid - Fenerbahce
programme.desc: The EuroLeague is the leading club basketball competition at the European level and is supported by Turkish Airlines.Each year, 18 teams are included in the tournament, which go through a regular season in a "everyone against everyone" format with an exchange of hosts.Twelve of them have guaranteed participation - these are Anadolu Efes, ASVEL, Bayern Munich, Barcelona, ​​Fenerbahce, Maccabi, Olympia Milano, Olympiakos, Panathinaikos, Real Madrid and Zalgiris.The remaining six positions are filled by clubs that meet certain criteria set by FIBA.After the regular season ends, the playoffs follow, with the top eight teams facing each other in best-of-three, five-game series.The winners qualify for the "Final Four", where the semi-finals and final are played on neutral ground to determine the champion of Europe.

programme.title: Soccer: Italian Serie A: Round 10: Cremonese - Juventus
programme.desc: Serie A is the highest football division in Italy.In the period 1898 – 1929, the Italian championship, then held on a regional basis, was called the National Football Championship (Campionato Nazionale di Football).It assumed its current name in 1929 when it switched to a "national divisions" format.Co-founders of Serie A are: Alessandria, Ambrosiana, Bologna, Brescia, Cremonese, Genoa, Juventus, Lazio, Livorno, Milan, Modena, Napoli, Padova, Pro Patria, Pro Vercelli, Roma, Torino and Triestina.The first championship in Serie A is Ambrosiana.Three of the leading teams not only at the national, but also at the European and World level are Juventus, Milan and Inter, but there are also teams with great success such as Lazio, Roma, Napoli, Genoa, Torino, Bologna, Fiorentina, Atalanta, Cagliari, Verona, Sampdoria and Parma.

programme.desc: Serie A is the highest football division in Italy.In the period 1898 – 1929, the Italian championship, then held on a regional basis, was called the National Football Championship (Campionato Nazionale di Football).It assumed its current name in 1929 when it switched to a "national divisions" format.Co-founders of Serie A are: Alessandria, Ambrosiana, Bologna, Brescia, Cremonese, Genoa, Juventus, Lazio, Livorno, Milan, Modena, Napoli, Padova, Pro Patria, Pro Vercelli, Roma, Torino and Triestina.The first championship in Serie A is Ambrosiana.Three of the leading teams not only at the national, but also at the European and World level are Juventus, Milan and Inter, but there are also teams with great success such as Lazio, Roma, Napoli, Genoa, Torino, Bologna, Fiorentina, Atalanta, Cagliari, Verona, Sampdoria and Parma.

programme.title: Soccer: Saudi Professional League: Round 6: Al Nasser - Al Fayha
programme.desc: The Saudi Professional League was founded in 1976. It is the direct successor of the Royal Cup, which was the only tournament since the late 1950s.The most titled club is Al-Hilal.The team plays its matches at the 58,000-capacity King Fahd Stadium in the capital, Riyadh.Other popular clubs are: Al-Ittihad, Al-Nasr, Al-Shabab and Al-Ahli.In 2023, a solid number of famous football players from Europe signed quite lucrative contracts with local teams.One of the first and most significant names was that of Cristiano Ronaldo, who signed with Al-Nasr.Other famous footballers who moved to the Saudi Pro League are: Neymar, Karim Benzema, N'Golo Kante, Roberto Firmino, Marcelo Brozovic, Sadio Mane, Riyad Mahrez, Jordan Henderson and others.

programme.title: Soccer: Spanish La Liga: Round 11: Real Madrid v Valencia
programme.desc: The Primera División, also known as La Liga, is the top-level division in Spain's professional football league hierarchy.The highest level of football in Spain began its history in 1929. The founders of the league in 1929 were Barcelona, ​​Real Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Real Sociedad, Arenas, Atlético Madrid, Espanyol, Europa, Real Union, Racing Santander.Since the 1950s, Real Madrid and Barcelona have dominated this championship.The other teams that have won the championship are Atlético Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Valencia, Real Sociedad, Real Betis, Deportivo La Coruña and Sevilla.La Liga is considered one of the strongest leagues in Europe along with the Italian Serie A and the English Premier League.

The founders of the league in 1929 were Barcelona, ​​Real Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Real Sociedad, Arenas, Atlético Madrid, Espanyol, Europa, Real Union, Racing Santander.Since the 1950s, Real Madrid and Barcelona have dominated this championship.The other teams that have won the championship are Atlético Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Valencia, Real Sociedad, Real Betis, Deportivo La Coruña and Sevilla.La Liga is considered one of the strongest leagues in Europe along with the Italian Serie A and the English Premier League.

programme.title: Soccer: Saudi Professional League: Round 6: Al Nasser - Al Fayha
programme.desc: The Saudi Professional League was founded in 1976. It is the direct successor of the Royal Cup, which was the only tournament since the late 1950s.The most titled club is Al-Hilal.The team plays its matches at the 58,000-capacity King Fahd Stadium in the capital, Riyadh.Other popular clubs are: Al-Ittihad, Al-Nasr, Al-Shabab and Al-Ahli.In 2023, a solid number of famous football players from Europe signed quite lucrative contracts with local teams.One of the first and most significant names was that of Cristiano Ronaldo, who signed with Al-Nasr.Other famous footballers who moved to the Saudi Pro League are: Neymar, Karim Benzema, N'Golo Kante, Roberto Firmino, Marcelo Brozovic, Sadio Mane, Riyad Mahrez, Jordan Henderson and others.

programme.title: Football: Copa Libertadores: Semi-final second leg: Racing Club - Flamengo
programme.desc: Copa Libertadores is an annual football tournament featuring the best teams from South America and, in recent years, from Mexico.The tournament is the equivalent of the European Champions League.

programme.desc: The Copa Sudamericana (Spanish: Copa Sudamericana) is the second most powerful club football tournament in South America.Unlike the European Champions League and the UEFA Cup, the Copa Sudamericana also features teams that also participate in the strongest South American tournament, the Copa Libertadores.
